channel.title: Home on Joe Wright's Github Site
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Joe Wright's Github Site

item.title: What was the most valuable position in the NBA during the 2019-2020 season?
item.description: One of the longest held debates amongst NBA fanatics is over which player deserves the Most Valuable Player (MVP) award for each given season. It is a purposefully subjective award that stirs the pot and incites heated arguments between both media members and fans about what value really means in the NBA. While this debate is a fascinating discussion, I want to look at player value in a broader sense.

item.title: Sports Data Analysis and Visualization
item.description: This is a faux post for my website so I can get the hang of posting blogs! For my big project this semester, I’m interested in finding out what position in the NBA is the most important? I want to analyze which position brings a team the most win shares and which players in said positions are outliers. I’m also interested in finding out which position has the best shooting percentages, turnover ratio and more!

item.title: About Joe
item.description: I’m an undergraduate student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln pursuing a double major in Sports Media Communications and Advertising/Public Relations with a minor in political science. I have a varied set of work experiences in the journalism field working for national sports networks as well as writing for a major local and university newspaper. I intend to utilize my journalism experience to work towards a leadership career in advertising and communications.

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.
